headline: Trump attacks Biden following the former VP's latest gaffe
subHeadline: Biden says 'poor kids' just as bright as 'white kids'; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Dan Bongino, Dona Brazile, Lawrence Jones and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City and this is "The Five." President Trump not backing down as outrage from the left intensifies over a fundraiser hosted by the chairman of Equinox and Soulcycle. The president in New York earlier today for the event at Hamptons home of CEO Stephen Ross. The outrage growing while celebrities are cancelling their memberships and urging others to boycott the trendy gyms. Some in the media taking the attacks even further believe it or not.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I want pitch forks and torches outside this man's house in the Hamptons. I've been to the Hamptons. It's very nice. There is no reason why it has to be.

utterances.speaker: DONNY DEUTSCH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: You don't get to say I am for racial equality and all these good things. I disagree with him there, but I like his economic views happens (ph). No, you own it. You own the blood that (inaudible). You own -- Charlottesville -- you can't do it. You get the whole package and that's what swing voters have got to understand and be shamed into.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: President Trump responding by defending Stephen Ross and saying the backlash well, it's going to backfire.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: Stephen Ross is a great friend of mine. He is a very successful guy. By the way, I think he is probably more inclined to be a liberal if you want to know the truth. But he likes me. He respects me. The controversy makes Steve much hotter. They will figure that out in about a week. But he is very happy. He's got a very successful -- a lot of people are going. I guess they are going to raise $11 or $12 million. Not billion. Million.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: But Mr. President, when you talk --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I'm getting used to say billion. We're talking about a lot of money.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And he was right. The RNC just put out a notice that President Trump raised $12 million today. So, the campaign is awash in money, Dan.

utterances.speaker: DAN BONGINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: You know, how sorry and sad of a life do you have to have to be focused on these endless boycotts all the time? I mean, seriously, go to your kid's soccer game Hit a baseball. Have popcorn. Go to a movie. And here's a difference between the right and left boycotts. I know we talked about this yesterday a little bit, but you know, the right usually boycotts things because people's companies crap all over America or because the people's way of life. Things are important. You know, the Betsy Ross flag thing, people kneeling in front of the flag.  The left boycotts on the dumbest things ever. So you get this guy Ross who is clearly not a conservative by the way, put out a very, you know, nice statements, and listen, I don't agree with everything Donald Trump says. I engage both Democrats and Republicans. Clearly wants to get some conversation going with the president.   And they sit there and they boycott like they have nothing else to do. I mean, where are the soccer moms that go to a soccer game? Dad, go to a game, enjoy your life. Stop boycotting everything. I mean, is there a list of all the liberal boycotts. This stuff is so silly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I did wonder, Greg, about Danny Deutsch was saying that you own everything. So if you support a politician that that means you own everything they say. I don't live my life like that.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: I think it's better to try to be Danny Trejo and not be Donny Deutsch-bag, because this wisest (ph) boycott, especially disruptive, because you are linking innocent people to a horrific event.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And then you instigate a mob on twitter. So what you're doing is create the target and you mobilize a mob. I mean, this action, mob action. It's not really a boycott. It's more like get them. Get these people. And the great thing --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Pitchfork.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, pitchfork. He actually said it. So the great thing about "The Five" is that we can actually read the mood of a nation. You know what, even if we want to say certain things, we wake up every morning and we ask ourselves whether we're going to be a plus or a minus, right. We're going to --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm a plus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You are a plus! I tried it. I'm plus size, but viewers -- I think our viewers are no different. They don't want to go to -- they don't go to work thinking I'm going to make somebody pay. And I think at MSNBC, you got to ask yourself like, do you want to wake up every morning and make a terrible week worse, because that's what you are doing. You are actually -- they are not reading the mood of the nation. They are not checking the thermostat. If they check the thermostat, they wouldn't keep turning it up. And what they're doing, they're saying people have blood up -- swing voters have blood on their hands. You are demonizing, you're escalating the demonization and that just makes the matters worse. You can disagree with people and wait it out and calm down, but this isn't right. It's not right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What do you think about that Donna in terms of when people criticize the president, his supporters tend to think that that criticism is also aimed at them?

utterances.speaker: DONNA BRAZILE, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: And people felt the same way when people went after personalities, media personalities went after President Obama. Look, the outrage machine is pretty active on both sides. I recall a couple of months ago when I got a message that I couldn't go to Home Depot, all right. And then --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And why was that -- what was the --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: This was because the owner of Home Depot had made a comment that he was going to give to the president's campaign. Unfortunately, I was one of those people that for years begged for Home Depot to come into the inner city of Washington, D.C. and that was my go to place because I like to pick up dirt, the real kind. But, then I'm like, oh, god, I have a coupon. I need to go to Home Depot before the boycott begins. And I'll never forget, that afternoon I ran to Home Depot and I wanted to put on a disguise but I realized no one looks like me so why not.  I remember when some people on the right, they were criticizing Netflix. They say boycott Netflix. Boycott Orioles.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That didn't work.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I cannot. Boycott -- wait, I've got a list -- Starbucks, Wayfair, Nike -- this is -- AT&T. The president tweeted that. So, stop the outrage machine. This is free speech. When you decide to get -- if you run for Congress again, I might give you a nickel or two. I'm not giving you all my money.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: I will never run for Congress.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: All my money.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: You have my commitment on "The Five." No way.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: All right, but I might give you -- I might even throw a fundraiser because I know you and I like you, OK.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Wow. That's very nice of you.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But the point -- hell yeah!

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: I'd really appreciate that.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Do you think I am scared?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Hell no!

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Really not.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: And you better wear your Sunday best, honey. And by the way, I feel sick.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Lawrence, did you go to the gym today? You said yesterday was a little light. How about today?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, they're light today as well.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Is the boycott working?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I think its working and I don't care because I've been waiting for the --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: What gym did you go to?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Equinox, as I always do because it's a clean gym and that's the only thing I care about.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is the cleanest gym. It is the cleanest gym.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: It's very clean, right? The point that bothers me about this entire debate is the hypocrisy -- hypocrisy in saying that the president is the only one that's escalating things, right? The Democrats and the president aren't far apart when it comes to tone of things. But it's only one side telling the other side to calm down. I think America's at this breaking point right now where everything is being taken so personal. The only difference is that the Democrats like to call the Republicans hateful people, right. Any time that we like something then we are the racists.  And they also are the ones that like us, we saw on T.V. saying show up to people's homes with pitch forks. When we don't like something, either there is a boycott but there is not any antagonizing coming with guns and just intimidate people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Also you could say -- but also, it's like you say you don't like it and then you go on --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Right. And you just go --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and you go to dinner and you to a soccer game.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Right. Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I do want to play this for -- I'm going to play the sound bite and --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But why do we call these people Democrats?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Because they are Democrats.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I don't know they are party affiliated.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Donna, let me play this sound from President Trump. Remember we talked about that movie yesterday that was coming out and --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "The Hunt."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, the hunting and the people or all of that stuff. President Trump --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hunting and the people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- was asked about that today at the White House and he had this to say.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: But Hollywood is really terrible. You talk about racism. Hollywood is racist. What they are doing with the kind of movies they are putting out is actually very dangerous for our country. What Hollywood is doing is a tremendous disservice to our country.   We have now in a little while, all of the heads of the biggest companies coming in and we're going to talk to them. They treat conservatives and Republicans totally different than they treat others. They can't do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He started off talking about Hollywood kind of punching back, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, this is always going to be, you know, Hollywood is the land of the left and so there's always going to be this conflict, but the last couple of days we have seen a lot of incidents happening at Wal- Mart. But it is really because of this galvanized hyper-intense coverage we've seen in Springfield, Missouri and Florida and Washington.  And the thing is, it's not just about the left versus the right and these people suck and these people don't. It's that the fact that this continues and that it keeps escalating. And that what happens is you have lonely, alienated individuals who see this as an opportunity for infamy, and that's what I worry about.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: It's also, the coverage is also agenda driven, right, because when it came down to Chicago and 59 people shot, right, and seven people killed, the media was utterly silent when it came to that. And so I think the media because they have decided to pick teams and pick issues, they only cover it when it's hate-filled. But I think any murder, no matter if they had an agenda to kill Mexican or they're killing people because of drugs should be covered. But that's not what we are seeing here.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Well, let's make a distinction between the local media and the national media because I do know that local media often cover these stories. National media, national cable, we tend to get into this outrage stuff and it sells. I don't know, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And the problem is, what the local media is, local media is suffering because everybody -- because it can't survive in the era of online stuff so all the newspaper are gone.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: I think the outrage stuff too but why aren't they outraged about what's happening in Chicago?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: It should be.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: They are.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that most of the media --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: No, they're not. They --

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: -- nationally. Why aren't they?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: They should be outraged. They should be outraged --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Because of agenda. Its agenda --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Whether it's killing nationally or locally. That is untrue.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: No. It's because -- no, it's because it's (inaudible) Democrats, that's why.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: You're treating murder as a red versus blue. Murder is murder.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: No question.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That is a good way to end the segment because we have more coming up. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden is not playing with a full deck. This is not somebody you could have as your president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We got details on that ahead.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Oh god, it's Friday and President Trump is going after Joe Biden over his latest campaign misstep. This after the 2020 front runner had a slip of the tongue in Iowa.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: We should challenge students in these schools. They have advanced placement programs in these schools. We have this notion that somehow if you are poor you cannot do it. Poor kids are just as bright and just as talented as white kids, wealthy kids, black kids, Asian kids. No, I really mean it, but think how we think about it.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Well, well, well. The vice-president quickly corrected himself but that didn't stop President Trump from taking a swipe at Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Look, Joe is not playing with a full deck. He made that comment. I said, whoa! I saw it because I was on something. I had a television. I saw his comment. Joe Biden is not playing with a full deck. This is not somebody you could have as your president. But if he got the nomination, I would be thrilled.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Oh my god. So, I don't want to get into the substance. Let me get into the superficial. So, Joe Biden has been known to, you know, misspeak from time to time.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: You think?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: It really was a slippery slop but he quickly gained his footing and got it right and said wealthy kid.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: You're really dancing on this one?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I am dancing. You want -- I can -- but you know what? He picked his step up.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: No, but he always slips with black people. Remember Obama was an educated, articulate --

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: He was clean.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Clean. He was clean.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: -- cold shower -- clean -- clean. And with the Democrats already having a problem not with the black vote but black voters actually showing up to the polls, even though they may not vote for Republicans, they may stay at home because the Democratic Party is not doing a good job to get those votes. And look, I'm sorry, if this is the best that the Democrats have to go against Donald Trump, it's going to be a sad, sad day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But doesn't -- I know your leading (ph) the segment, Donna, but I will ask you. Isn't it true that so far Joe Biden has been able to hold the highest amount of support for African-Americans voters?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: His support -- his support among African-Americans after Kamala Harris went after him in the first debate, his support almost doubled. Kamala was -- she had a double digit, you know, percentage with black voters. After that "interchange," Joe Biden's support went up.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: We saw that with Hillary too, though.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I don't think this is about taking anyone for granted because we know that black voters right now are still with the Democratic candidates. What I do believe is that Joe Biden, when he is having these riffs, talking about every child deserves a shot, every child is -- he slipped. Maybe in his mind he thought white, but he was trying to say wealthy. I don't know how you make that slip but he made it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The thing is, I mean, I tend to agree with you but I just know that if a Republican would have done that --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Oh god.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- my god, he would have been barbecued. But his gaffes are not new. What's new is when he gets through a thought without a gaff. There was some that I think one of our producer has an interesting piece of tape. Do we have that? Let's listen to this. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: We excuse unity over division. We choose science over fiction. We choose truth over facts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, I mean, that to me is better because he like to, you know, he's almost -- I mean, this is the biggest fight of his life and he is doing it in his 8th decade. I would be really -- if I was in the Democratic Party I would be worried. This is early.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But Dana, do you recall how many gaffs had President Trump made in the last six weeks of the 2016 election?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I do, except for I feel like kind of what's happening with Biden, the people who supported President Trump, it just made them even more endeared to him and I think that that's happened for Biden as well.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: And here's the thing, here's what people should know about Joe Biden. He has one of the best civil rights record of any politician running today and I say that out of respect for a lot of people including Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren, Kamala Harris and Cory Booker, et cetera. The fact is, is that he's been on the front lines fighting civil rights, equal justice, women --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I don't know if black and black --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: So, I don't think this is going to hurt him.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: -- Donald Trump has his great --

utterances.speaker: BRAZIL
utterances.sentences: I think Joe Biden will be careful next time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Has Biden freed a rapper? Trump has.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: But this -- he said Joe Biden is the Teddy Ruxpin of gaffes. You drop a quarter and a gaffe comes out. Remember that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: And it wasn't even the Obama's clean line. That was awful. He was -- remember the line -- he was the first African-American, not the first black man or woman I've ever met who was clean and articulate. It was just -- yet if a Republican had said that, it would be over. But this is fascinating, your standard here. He has a good record on civil rights.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: He has a great record.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: So, Donald Trump, historically low black and Latino unemployment and yet everything Donald Trump says is a dog whistle. Donald Trump's talking -- that's a dog whistle. He's a racist.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Because --

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Wait, wait, no. Hold on.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I know what you're saying.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump lowered flags to half staff on August 8th. Numerology guy from the FBI goes on MSDNC and says this is clearly a reference the Arian Brotherhood in the prison. You're like, is this guy insane? So what I don't get is, is there a standard here or not? Is Joe Biden not going to be held to account by the media?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Was that a slip? You said M-S-D-N-C. Was that a slip?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: No, that is what they do. They're all --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: All right. I just wanted to make sure.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: They had a really rough week with the numerology guy.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Well, here's what I do know, is that Joe Biden is strong. If he wins the Democratic nomination, we don't know. I believe he will get 90 percent more of the black vote. We'll see.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: But can I ask you (inaudible). How is that not a dog whistle?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: That's not a dog whistle.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Slipping of the tongue by going -- when you say something like hey, they're as smart as the white kids?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: He's saying poor kids, poor. He didn't say black kids. He said poor kids.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but what does do being white?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Look, poor kids --

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Listen --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: -- he corrected himself. He misspoke.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: He did not say poor kids --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: He makes his mistakes all the time.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Look, without Joe Biden we wouldn't have anything to talk about on Friday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but in a way, can I just make one point. The gaffes between -- to your point about Trump and the gaffes of Biden, Trump's gaffes don't seem related to age whereas Biden, it makes it feel like he is slowing. He is slowing down. I think that's the concern.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think that people might say Trump's gaffes -- they bring up other connotation not age --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Oh my god, they bring up a lot.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- because like then he's mean or that he's like, you know, that - -

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Insensitive.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- I think that they both have their supporters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Trump is getting younger.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: All right. Folks, New York Democrats --

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Benjamin Button.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: -- New York Democrats, not all New York Democrats, but maybe a few, are blocking a bill that would make it a felony for dowsing the cops. Let's talk about this in the next segment.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Two stories that highlight the utter lunacy of the left. First, we've been showing you the disgraceful water bucket attacks on our police. Now Democrats here in New York State are blocking a Republican bill that would make it a felony to dump water on cops. One liberal state lawmaker is calling the proposal a "major overreaction." Greg, this has me a little fired up because I think as a former police officers myself, I don't think anyone has started to do the practical implications of this. Number one, there is obvious. There could be a chemical in there. Likely (inaudible), but it could happen and it's worthy enough that we shouldn't do. But secondly, their equipment is electronic. Their radios, some of their equipment -- has anybody thought of this? If you can dump water on cops, you can render a lot of their communications gear completely infective. Why would any sane person -- and I just say that and I thought (inaudible) cop story really pisses me off. You know, I say to anyone who objects to this, you know, get your butts out of the chair and get your butt in a uniform or go do a ride along with a cop one day and see the crap they have to deal with. And then think it's -- then tell me its unfair t, you know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The problem with this kind of thing is that nobody like -- if a cop reacts to this, the defense, it was just water. It was just water.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What are you supposed to do? So I think this -- the fact that the Democrats are blocking this is born from a fear of the reaction from activists, which is what has been -- it's like, will they come after me? Will they shout at me at a meeting? Will they come after me on twitter? So they're willing to sacrifice the safety of the police and the community that they police so they don't get swarmed by activists.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: So, the lawmaker who introduced this bill in Albany. I looked it up. First of all, my Uncle Nat retired from the New York police department. My cousin Marky (ph), was injured on the job and as a result, he is not able to work. I still have a cousin in New Orleans on active duty, so I take what's happening here in New York very seriously. It's not just water, and we think that's harmless, it's not. Some of us who've been hit by a water bottle know it's not harmless. But they are also throwing rocks and concrete. So, this is clearly a crime. They've arrested some people. The question is, before Albany is, will these individuals be charged with a felony? And some of the Democrats oppose the, whatever, the sentence. They want it to be a misdemeanor. But the bottom line this is wrong, people! This is wrong. These are men and women that we pay to protect us, to be there when we need them. Not to throw water or concrete or bottles. So please, lighten up. Do not do this. This is bad. And the police will arrest you.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: You know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Problem is, where do you put them? Because you're going to -- we're closing up Ryker's.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: I was a cop --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I think that if it is a felony, that you are less likely to do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Well, here's a problem --

utterances.sentences: All right. Greg Gutfeld Show that's tomorrow night 10 PM. I got Terry Schappert; I've got Rob Long. I've got Kat Timpf, I've got Tyrus. That's tomorrow. 10 PM, August 10th. Dana, check out this, not just one thirsty hedgehog but I've got three thirsty hedgehogs Aren't they adorable? Now there is--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How does this show that animals are great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hedgehog--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They're just drinking water.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what I like their style. I like their concentrations.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: They're not rats, are they?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, they're not rats.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Kind of.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're sexy rats. That's what they are. And that's why, Animals Are Great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Hedgehogs are fine. But next time work on the video. All right. Earlier this week the South Bend Fire Department saved a pair of raccoons from a raging warehouse fire. So, these raccoons were on the top of the roof there and the fire broke out and the firemen figured out a way to help get them down. That's really going above and beyond to get two ladders and help these raccoons. I don't know a lot of people especially my sister would not have helped those raccoons.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A lot of people don't like racoons.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The South Bend Fire Department said life safety and property conservation are their two priorities on a fire scene and that extends to all creatures. I don't know if Mayor Peter was involved.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: They look like rats. I'm not for it. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dan, your turn.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: This is a tremendous story. An American hero remains have finally returned home after going missing in 1967. Travelers in Dallas were able to witness an emotional moment when the plane carrying Vietnam veteran Colonel Roy Knight Junior's remains touched down. Amazingly the veteran's son Captain Knight was the pilot flying the plane with his heroic father's remains. Captain Knight alongside the crew and a military guard saluted the Vietnam veteran as he returned home 52 years later, I've lost an uncle in Vietnam rather heroically God bless all of you who served you--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dan, and really interesting thing about this story too is that the son last saw his father at that airport where they flew back into.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: What a story.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: An amazing eight story.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Great story.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Lawrence.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: On this day in 1936, Jesse Owens, the son of Alabama sharecropper wins his fourth gold medal at the Berlin Olympians as the United States takes first place in the 400-meter relay. This was important as well because Hitler was there watching, and this was a major blow send a black man represent the United States. And it was a blow to his propaganda. Rest in peace.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's amazing video.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Rest in peace.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Donna.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Well, happy birthday to Smokey the Bear. It's his 75th birthday. Many of us remember Smokey the Bear, the cartoon and that famous line, only you can prevent forest fires. Well, I still believe 75 years later, this bear is still a national treasure. So, happy birthday Smokey the Bear.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think Smokey the Bear was a very dangerous symbol because it convinced bears that they could wear hats and once bears start wearing hats and they start wearing shirts Hawaiian shirts, shorts--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then they just blend right in.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Sexy Greg, something you might not understand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Look, I met a lot of bears in my time.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: You have the tie.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Did you have any--

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Did I have any other questions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's see.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, no. A moment from your childhood or early adulthood that you're glad happened before the invention of cell phone cameras and social media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My entire life.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, entire life.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Everything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My entire life.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Everything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: None of us would have jobs.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I'm the young one, don't worry.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Excuse us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana would be fine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait there was a dark side to Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well not dark - Instagram my plane trip that my parents didn't know I went on.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But I will have more pictures of my childhood and more pictures of my parents, so I'm a little sad.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. We wish you had more pictures.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. That's it for us. We'll see you back here on Monday. Have a great weekend everybody from all of us at "The Five."
